content:
I see the issue - I was trying to access entities that don't exist yet. Let's start fresh with what we know we have:

```python
# First check what entities we have
print(f"Current entities on map: {get_entities()}")

# Check our current inventory
print(f"Current inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Let's craft a burner mining drill if we have enough materials
if inspect_inventory().get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 3:
    craft_item(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill)
    print(f"Crafted a mining drill")

# Get some coal for fuel
coal_pos = nearest(Resource.Coal)
move_to(coal_pos)
harvest_resource(coal_pos, quantity=25)

# Find a good spot near iron ore to place our mining drill
iron_pos = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(iron_pos)

# Place the mining drill if we have one
if Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill in inspect_inventory():
    drill = place_entity(
        Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill,
        position=iron_pos,
        direction=Direction.DOWN
    )
    
    # Add fuel to the drill
    if drill:
        insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill, quantity=10)
        print(f"Placed and fueled mining drill")

print(f"Final inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Updated entities: {get_entities()}")
```

This should give us a better picture of what we're working with and help us start automating our resource collection.
